comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Marquis Jean Pallavicini (1848-1941), Austro-Hungarian Ambassador at Constantinople, 1906-1918.  Opposed the annexation of Bosnia and Herzegovina in 1908.

comment.author: 32365432@N03
comment._content: His real name is John Pallavicini (Pallavicini János in Hungarian), his rank is Count or Earl. This is the French version of his name.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: "Johann Markgraf von Pallavicini (Hungarian: Pallavicini János őrgróf; 18 March 1848 – 4 May 1941), was an Austro-Hungarian diplomat, notably serving as Ambassador at the Sublime Porte during World War I." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marquis_Johann_von_Pallavicini
